headline: Gen Z's credit scores are dropping. Here's what to do if yours is too
summary: Gen Z has seen its credit scores drop more than any other generation over the past year, largely because of student loan debt, according to a new report out this week.  The total national average credit score dropped two points this year to 715, according to the report from credit scoring company FICO.  A credit score is a mathematical formula that helps lenders determine how likely you are to pay back a loan.
